intro: Achroanthes unifolia, commonly known as the singleleaf achroanthes, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slight hairy texture. Achroanthes unifolia is typically found in moist, sandy soils in open woodlands and along stream banks.
